metadata.Title: CVE-2013-2124 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Double free vulnerability in inspect-fs.c in LibguestFS 1.20.x before 1.20.7, 1.21.x, 1.22.0, and 1.23.0 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (crash) via empty guest files.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2013-2124` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

erlang-guestfs - 1:1.32.2-4ubuntu2.2
gir1.2-guestfs-1.0 - 1:1.32.2-4ubuntu2.2
guestfsd - 1:1.32.2-4ubuntu2.2
libguestfs-gfs2 - 1:1.32.2-4ubuntu2.2
libguestfs-gobject-1.0-0 - 1:1.32.2-4ubuntu2.2
libguestfs-hfsplus - 1:1.32.2-4ubuntu2.2
libguestfs-java - 1:1.32.2-4ubuntu2.2
libguestfs-jfs - 1:1.32.2-4ubuntu2.2
libguestfs-nilfs - 1:1.32.2-4ubuntu2.2
libguestfs-ocaml - 1:1.32.2-4ubuntu2.2
libguestfs-perl - 1:1.32.2-4ubuntu2.2
libguestfs-reiserfs - 1:1.32.2-4ubuntu2.2
libguestfs-rescue - 1:1.32.2-4ubuntu2.2
libguestfs-rsync - 1:1.32.2-4ubuntu2.2
libguestfs-tools - 1:1.32.2-4ubuntu2.2
libguestfs-xfs - 1:1.32.2-4ubuntu2.2
libguestfs-zfs - 1:1.32.2-4ubuntu2.2
libguestfs0 - 1:1.32.2-4ubuntu2.2
lua-guestfs - 1:1.32.2-4ubuntu2.2
php-guestfs - 1:1.32.2-4ubuntu2.2
python-guestfs - 1:1.32.2-4ubuntu2.2
python3-guestfs - 1:1.32.2-4ubuntu2.2
ruby-guestfs - 1:1.32.2-4ubuntu2.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libguestfs package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:1.32.2-4ubuntu2.2').
